content:
衛生福利部民國107年7月20日 衛部秘字第1072161286號通知單註銷密等
to be undertaken an outbreaks of food poisoning. These investigations may be done by the local laboratory in collaboration with the medical officer of health, or, in special circumstances, by a member of the Epidemiological Research Laboratory.
The public Health Laboratory Service has a Salmonella Sub-committee on which serve those directors of area laboratories interested in the salmonella problem, a veterinary bacteriollgist, an epidemiollgist, and the Director of the Salmonella Reference Laboratory. This is a working comittee which investigates various sources of salmonella infection. So far, surveys of hens' eggs, ducks' eggs, carcase meat, healthy persons etc., have been undertaken.
The Director of the Salmonella Reference Laboratory serves on a number of committees where salmonella problems arise, such as the Egg products Microbiological Group, Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food.
The Director of the Salmonella Reference Laboratory is also asked for advice in the treatment of both human clinical cases and carriers of salmonellae, and is expected to know something of the treatment of animals and their environment, or at least to be able to put people in touch. 213.82
The Salmonella Reference Laboratory receives for training many laboratory workers both from this country and from overseas.
To summarize, the Salmonella Reference Laboratory is prepared to assist in any salmonella problem, either clinical, hygiene, environmental or technical. The Salmonella Reference Laboratory expects to be aware of the distribution of salmonella types in the country, and in various foods, animals, reptiles and birds."
It must be emphasized that the International Centres are not equipped or expecteda to carry out routine typing of salmonella, escherichia or shigella strains for National Centres, this naturally being a function of the National Centres themselves. National Centres should therefore be staffed by skilled enteric bacteriologists, and in any country where such personnel is not yet available it would be advisable for the designation or appointment of a National Centre to be deferred until the Centre can, in fact, be staffed by skilled bacteriologists. National Centres should prepare and distribute the diagnostic materials needed in other laboratories within their own territories, because the International Centres cannot undertake to provide more than the standard materials which will enable this to be done.
2) 216 Academia Historicą
